Article Title: HC disposes TMC MP Mahua Moitra's plea after BJP's Nishikant Dubey removes post
Article Text:
TMC MP Mahua Moitra's, BJP's Nishikant Dubey (File photos)

NEW DELHI: The Delhi High Court disposed of TMC MP Mahua Moitra 's interim plea last week after being informed that BJP MP Nishikant dubey had removed an allegedly defamatory social media post against Moitra.Advocate Jai Anant Dehadrai, who had also published a post against Moitra on social media. assured Justice Manmeet Pritam Singh Arora of the removal of the post from his X handle.Moitra had claimed to have been aggrieved by Dubey's post on Facebook and the X post by Dehadrai, which also had a screenshot of Dubey's Facebook post. The content of the posts was related to a CBI case involving Moitra and a Lokpal judgment on a complaint by Dubey against the TMC MP.Dubey's counsel noted contended that it was Moitra's use of derogatory words and phrases with innuendos that had provoked the BJP functionary.Moitra's counsel, however, pointed out that the objectionable word used in the post on her social media handles did not related to Dubey. The court took her statement on record and said she was bound to the same.Moitra had initiated the fresh plea amid her pending defamation case against Dubey and Dehadrai over their allegedly false and defamatory allegations accusing her of taking bribes from businessman and Hiranandani Group CEO Darshan Hiranandani for asking questions in Parliament.
Article Summary: Delhi High Court disposed of TMC MP Mahua Moitra's interim plea last week. BJP MP Nishikant dubey had removed an allegedly defamatory social media post against Mo itra. Advocate Jai Anant Dehadrai assured Justice Manmeet Pritam Singh Arora of the removal of the post.

Article Title: Amit Shah, JP Nadda hail big BJP win in Assam panchayat polls
Article Text:
Amit Shah, JP Nadda

NEW DELHI: Home minister Amit Shah and other senior BJP functionaries on Tuesday hailed NDA's victory in Assam panchayat elections, calling it a historic mandate and a clear endorsement of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's development-focused governance.Shah expressed gratitude to the people of Assam for their overwhelming support and attributed the win to the transformative impact of the PM's "people-centric policies."In a post on X, Shah posted,"My heartfelt congratulations to CM Himanta Sarma, Assam BJP president Dilip Saikia and BJP Assam for their dedicated efforts to carry PM Modi's message of development door to door. Together, we will build a developed Assam for all." .BJP-led NDA registered a massive victory in the panchayat polls in Assam after BJP and its ally party Asom Gana Parishad (AGP) won 300 zila parishad seats and 1,436 Anchalik panchayat seats.Expressing gratitude to the people of Assam for trusting NDA, BJP president J P Nadda said, "This mandate is a testament to the people's confidence in the development-oriented policies and the remarkable progress Assam is witnessing under the visionary leadership of PM Narendra Modi .""Under the leadership of PM Modi , Team NDA has secured a sweeping victory in Assam Panchayat Polls 2025. The people's mandate is a resounding endorsement of our welfare-driven governance and a strong show of faith as we move towards 2026," Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.
Article Summary: BJP-led NDA registered a massive victory in the panchayat polls in Assam. BJP and its ally party Asom Gana Parishad (AGP) won 300 zila parishad seats. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said the people's mandate is a resounding endorsement of our welfare-driven governance.

Article Title: Who is Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma? Meet giant slayer BJP leader who has defeated AAP's Arvind Kejriwal in New Delhi assembly constituency
Article Text:
Parvesh hails from a prominent Delhi political family, being the son of former BJP leader and Delhi chief minister Sahib Singh Verma.

PARTY NAME



CANDIDATE



VOTES



AAP



Arvind Kejriwal



25999



BJP



Parvesh Verma



30088



CONGRESS



Sandeep Dikshit



4568





Who is Parvesh Verma?

Delhi election results 2025 : Who is Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma , the BJP leader who has emerged as a giant slayer by winning against former Delhi chief minister Arvind Kejriwal in the New Delhi assembly constituency ? It was a tough fight between Kejriwal and Verma with the leading and trailing numbers changing with each round of counting. Parvesh Verma has won against Arvind Kejriwal with a margin of 4,089 votes. Congress's Sandeep Dikshit was also fighting in the constituency.Here is the final vote count as per the Election Commission of India website:After his victory, Parvesh Verma when asked about being BJP's CM face said, "In our party, the legislative party decides (CM's face) and then the party leadership approves it. So the party's decision will be acceptable to everyone. I thank the voters of New Delhi, lakhs of hard-working workers and PM Narendra Modi. This is truly his victory. People have expressed their trust in him... Our priority will be to give Rs 2500 to women, create SIT to investigate corruption, Yamuna riverfront, reduce pollution, reduce traffic congestion... we will build such a capital that everyone will be proud of."Parvesh hails from a prominent Delhi political family, being the son of former BJP leader and Delhi chief minister Sahib Singh Verma. His uncle Azad Singh served as the North Delhi Municipal Corporation mayor and contested from Mundka constituency on a BJP ticket during the 2013 assembly polls.Born in 1977, Parvesh Verma completed his schooling at Delhi Public School, R.K. Puram, and subsequently obtained his Bachelor of Arts from Kirori Mal College, University of Delhi.Also Check | New Delhi election results 2025: It's Arvind Kejriwal vs Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma vs Sandeep Dikshit Following this, he pursued an MBA at the Fore School of Management.His entry into politics commenced in 2013 when he secured victory in the Delhi Legislative Assembly representing the Mehrauli constituency.He achieved further success by winning the West Delhi parliamentary seat in 2014, followed by a landslide re-election victory in 2019 where he won with a margin of 5.78 lakh.During his tenure as an MP, he has been a member of the Joint Committee on Salaries and Allowances of Members of Parliament and has served on the Standing Committee on Urban Development.Prior to the 2025 Delhi elections, Parvesh Verma initiated a campaign called "Remove Kejriwal, Save the Nation," criticising the current AAP administration for not fulfilling their primary commitments.In his campaign, Verma strongly condemned the Delhi government's administrative performance, specifically regarding their handling of pollution concerns, security for women, and civic infrastructure development. He specifically pointed out their unmet commitment to purify the Yamuna River, which remains a significant environmental challenge for the city.
Article Summary: Parvesh Verma has won against Arvind Kejriwal with a margin of 4,089 votes. Parvesh hails from a prominent Delhi political family, being the son of former Delhi chief minister Sahib Singh Verma. His entry into politics commenced in 2013 when he secured victory in the Delhi Legislative Assembly representing the Mehrauli constituency.

Article Title: Pollachi case file: 8 women raped, 4-member gang undressed 19-year-old in car, filmed her, 48 witnesses, tech evidence seal convictions
Article Text:
An accused being brought to Coimbatore district mahila court ahead of the verdict in the Pollachi gang rape case on Tuesday

'Judgment gives hope to women fighting against sexual assault'





COIMBATORE: More than six years after serial gangrapes in Pollachi rocked Tamil Nadu, a mahila court in Coimbatore on Tuesday found all the nine suspects guilty of gangrape and handed them imprisonment for life till death. It also directed the state govt to pay compensation of 85 lakh to the eight survivors.Coimbatore mahila court judge R Nandhini Devi, concurring with the CBI prosecutor's submissions, read out the verdict convicting all the nine and sentencing a few of them to double life imprisonment The nine men were found guilty of luring several young women, including college girls, with the promise of marriage, taking them to a secluded house and gang-raping them over a long period. They videographed the acts to threaten the survivors later.The atrocity came to light after a 19-year-old woman from a village near Pollachi came forward to lodge a police complaint in Feb 2019.Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) took over after the local police bungled the probe and made public personal details of a survivor.Immediately after the verdict was out, the Salem city armed reserve police escorted the accused - N Sabarirajan alias Rishwanth, 32, of Jothi Nagar; K Thirunavukkarasu, 34, of Makkinampatti; M Sathish, 33, and T Vasanthakumar, 30, of Suleeswaranpatti; R Mani, alias Manivannan, 32, of Achipatti; P Babu, 33, of Mahalingapuram; T Haronimus Paul alias Haron, 32, of Achipatti; K Arulanantham, 39, of Vadugapalayam; and M Arunkumar, 33, of Panikkampatti - to the Salem central prison.While seven convicts had their faces covered with handkerchiefs and masks, two others did not make any effort to hide their faces.Anticipating trouble, the Coimbatore city police placed barricades near the court to prevent onlookers and media from entering the court hall.The All-India Democratic Women's Association (AIDWA) welcomed the verdict, with its state treasurer A Radhika saying: "The then ruling party and police were attempting to close the Pollachi rape case in 2019. But the AIDWA held protests across the state against police and the then ruling AIADMK. Based on our protests, the accused were arrested. We welcome the judgment, and it would give hope to women who are fighting against sexual assault on women. "The AIDWA members distributed sweets to those present inside the combined court complex. V Surendra Mohan, special public prosecutor representing CBI, said all of the nine accused were sentenced to life imprisonment until death by the court, which directed the govt to provide ₹85 lakh compensation to the survivors."CBI and the prosecution's efforts didn't go waste, and the court gave proper justice to the victims. We welcome the judgment," said Surendra Mohan.Defence counsel A Pandiarajan said there were no direct witnesses for the alleged offence."We will appeal against the verdict in Madras high court," said Pandiarajan.The CBI invoked sections 120 (B), 342, 354, 354 (B), 366, 376 (D), and 376 (2) (n) of the IPC against all the nine accused.
Article Summary: Coimbatore mahila court judge R Nandhini Devi, concurring with the CBI prosecutor's submissions, read out the verdict convicting all the nine and sentencing a few of them to double life imprisonment. The nine men were found guilty of luring several young women, including college girls, with the promise of marriage. They videographed the acts to threaten the survivors later.
